```{r load-libraries}
location <- paste0(getwd())
source(paste0("../00_helpers/setup.R")) #common libraries and custom functions
source(paste0("../00_helpers/species_and_phases.R"))

sample_data <- readRDS(paste0(path_own_data, "/sample_data.rds"))

to_degree <- 180/pi
to_radians <- pi/180
```

### Data collection and processing

Coordinates of sampled SPN trees were recorded with a Garmin (?) with a
waypoint averaging time of 5 minutes or longer. Slope inclination, slope
aspect and crown exposition aspect were recorded with a Suunto Tandem.
Slope inclination was transformed from percent to degrees and a slope
inclination index was calculated to adjust the soil depth according to
slope inclination.

**Missing slope/aspect**

Free standing trees are exposed at 365 degrees. They receive the highest
radiation and the highest heat load and should therefore assume the
highest index/gradient value possible. Sites with zero inclination have
no slope aspect. A possible solution could be to assign the most
east/west aspect (CB 28.02.2022). In the final data set only RAF-FS was
in completely flat terrain.

We assumed that a not-northern aspect has the most influence on
phenological behavior because of heat load. However it is not known,
whether direct radiation is also a factor determining phenological
behavior. *Therefore, tree exposition aspect was considered with a heat
load index as well as a folded aspect, while slope exposition was
considered with a folded aspect only.*

#### East-west and north-south gradients

"The east-west gradient was derived as EW = sin(aspect/360×2π) with
east-facing sites assuming a value of 1 and west-facing sites -1. The
north-south gradient was derived as NS = cos(aspect/360×2π) with
north-facing sites assuming a value of 1 and south-facing sites -1"
[@bigler2016].

#### Heat load index and folded aspect

The folded aspect rescales the untransformed aspect to a value between 0
(northeast) and 180 (southwest).

$Folded \ aspect = | 180 – |aspect – 225| |$

[@mccune2002]

The head load index rescales the aspect to a scale of zero to one, with
zero being the coolest slope (northeast) and one being the warmest slope
(southwest).

$Heat \ load \ index = \frac{1 - \cos(\theta - 45)}{2}$

```{r topography-all, include=TRUE}
topography <- sample_data %>%
  #CORRECTIONS DOUBLE SLOPE ASPECTS
  mutate(SLOPE_ASPECT = SLOPE_ASPECT1_MAG,
         CROWN_EXPOSITION_ASPECT = case_when(
           #METEO_ID = "DOM" & SPECIES_TREE = "FS" ~ , #idk why I assignet two aspects here, it's clearly facing NNW
           METEO_ID == "EDB" & SPECIES_TREE == "TC" ~ SLOPE_ASPECT1_MAG, # macro relief
           METEO_ID == "LBU" & SPECIES_TREE == "LD" ~ SLOPE_ASPECT2_MAG, # macro relief
           METEO_ID == "MTI" & SPECIES_TREE == "RP" ~ SLOPE_ASPECT1_MAG, # macro relief
           METEO_ID == "OBO" & SPECIES_TREE == "FS" ~ SLOPE_ASPECT2_MAG, # macro relief
           METEO_ID == "RAF" & SPECIES_TREE == "RP" ~ SLOPE_ASPECT1_MAG, # no heat accumulation from the direction of the house because of house shade
           METEO_ID == "VSA" & SPECIES_TREE == "FS" ~ SLOPE_ASPECT1_MAG, # macro relief
           METEO_ID == "WIB" & SPECIES_TREE == "PA" ~ SLOPE_ASPECT1_MAG, # more southern exposition should be assigned
           METEO_ID == "WIB" & SPECIES_TREE == "FS" ~ SLOPE_ASPECT1_MAG, # more southern exposition should be assigned
           TRUE ~SLOPE_ASPECT)) %>% 
  #CORRECTION MISSING ASPECTS
  mutate(SLOPE_ASPECT=case_when(SAMPLE_CODE=="RAF_FS" ~ 190, TRUE ~ SLOPE_ASPECT)) %>%
  #SLOPE
  mutate(SLOPE_ASPECT_F = abs(180-abs(SLOPE_ASPECT-180)),
         SLOPE_ASPECT_EW = round(sin(SLOPE_ASPECT*to_radians),2),
         SLOPE_ASPECT_NS = round(cos(SLOPE_ASPECT*to_radians),2),
         SLOPE_ASPECT_HL = round((1-cos((SLOPE_ASPECT*to_radians)-pi/4))/2,2))
```

```{r pairs-topography, fig.height=9, warning=FALSE}
pairs_exposition <- topography %>% select(SLOPE_ASPECT, SLOPE_INCLINATION_DEG, SLOPE_ASPECT_F, SLOPE_ASPECT_EW, SLOPE_ASPECT_NS, SLOPE_ASPECT_HL)
ggpairs(pairs_exposition, showStrips=TRUE, progress=FALSE)+
  theme_report()
```

```{r distribution-transformed-aspects, include = TRUE, fig.cap="Distribution of transformed crown and slope exposition at sampled SPN stations. Original exposition measurement, gradient, heat load index and folded aspect"}
ggplot(data=topography %>%
  select(SPECIES_TREE, SLOPE_ASPECT, SLOPE_INCLINATION_DEG, SLOPE_ASPECT_F, SLOPE_ASPECT_EW, SLOPE_ASPECT_NS, SLOPE_ASPECT_HL) %>% 
  pivot_longer(cols=c(3:7), names_to = "PARAMETER", values_to = "EXPOSITION_VALUE"))+
  geom_violin(aes(x=SPECIES_TREE, y=EXPOSITION_VALUE))+
  geom_jitter(aes(x=SPECIES_TREE, y=EXPOSITION_VALUE), width = 0.1)+
  #geom_text(aes(x=SPECIES_TREE, y=PARAMETER, label = CROWN_EXPOSITION_ASPECT1_MAG), nudge_x = 0.2, size = 2.5)+
  facet_wrap(~PARAMETER, scales="free_y")+
  ylab("Transformed exposition") +
  xlab("Tree species")+
  theme_report()
```

```{r save-output}
saveRDS(topography %>% select(SAMPLE_CODE, contains("SLOPE"), contains("EXPOSITION"), TREE_ELEVATION, RELIEF, TREE_WGS_y_corrected, TREE_WGS_x_corrected) %>% ungroup(), paste0(path_own_data, "/input_topography.rds"))
```
